result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: General Alcohol Concentration Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: General Alcohol Concentration Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Ryan M. Palmer was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
10:29 AM Defendant Ryan M. Palmer in court with attorney Brendan P Delany.  Defendant Ryan M. Palmer in custody.  Rick C Spoentgen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and State states appearances.  Here today for sentencing after revocation.  Parties rec/rev revocation summary, no corrections to be made.  State makes recommendations.  Atty Delany makes statement.  DE makes statement on his own behalf.  Court admonishes DE and sentences.  DE advised re: voting rights and felony firearms warnings.

Ct 1:  
2 years prison (15 months initial confinement and 9 months extended supervision) to commence forthwith
Conditions of extended supervision:
Absolute sobriety at all times
Not to go to bars/taverns/liquor stores
No possession of alcohol
Not to operate any MV w/o valid DL
AODA and any follow up per agent
Seek/maintain full-time employment
Any other conditions per agent
305 days credit to be applied to include today's date
DE is eligible for ERP/CIP
Any outstanding court obligations to be converted to civil judgments
Defendant's Sentencing Memorandum
Sentencing hearing on revocation on January 2, 2019 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Ryan M. Palmer in court with attorney Puck Tsai.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Tsai has received information and enters not guilty plea.  Court enters Not Guilty Plea, set for trial.  Bond continues.
Arraignment on October 3, 2016 at 11:00 am.
for joinder

Defendant Ryan M. Palmer in court with attorney Puck Tsai.  Rick Speontgen appeared for the State of Wisconsin w/Off. Joshua Hoege for RPD.  State notes PH's will be proceeding today w/prelims in all but 13CT277 and 16CF149.  15CF273 a motion to dismiss has been filed and a motion to revoke the DPA has been filed.  15CF273 there is a motion to dismiss filed by DE.  13CT277 has been tracking and is now waiting for hearing to revoke the DPA.  Atty Tsai responds to motions filed.  State addresses 13CT277 - would like that to be closed today if possible so DE isn't facing any more bailjumping charges.  Atty Tsai responds/they are not ready to proceed w/that motion in 13CT277.  15CF273 is a motion to dismiss and the State is ready to proceed.  Court in 13CT277 will order it be set for a seperate motion hearing to revoke this matter.  Court notes motion to dismiss in 15CF273.  Atty Tsai states his argument to the Court re: his motion to dismiss in 15CF273.  State responds/notes they intend to file a motion for joinder when today's hearings are complete.  Parties argue.  Court denies motion to dismiss in 15CF273.  State notes charges that are going to be addressed at prelim today.  Atty Tsai requests they all be done individually.  State responds.  State calls Off. Joshua Hoege - RPD - S&T in 15CF217.  Witness ID's DE.  Record to reflect ID.  Atty Tsai does cross-exam.  State makes closing argument.  Atty Puck makes closing argument.  State responds.  Court finds probable cause for DE to be bound over in 15CF217.  State calls Off. Hoege in 15CF269 - already sworn.  Witness ID's DE.  Atty Tsai does cross-exam.  State does re-direct.  Court finds probable cause in 15CF269 and binds DE over.  Court requests a time reference as to how long to complete these matters.  Notes these might have to be set over until later today.  State calls Off. Hoege in 15CF273 - already sworn.  Witness ID's DE.  Record to reflect ID.  Atty Tsai does cross-exam.  Atty Tsai does closing argument.  State does rebuttal closing.  Court finds probable cause in 15CF273 and binds DE over.  State calls Off. Hoege again in 16CF7 - already sworn.  Witness ID's DE.  Record to reflect ID.  Atty Tsai does cross-exam.  Atty Tsai makes argument.  Court finds probable cause as to 16CF7 and binds DE over.  State calls Off. Hoege in 16CF31 - already sworn.  Witness ID's DE.  Record to reflect ID.  Atty Tsai does cross-exam.  Court finds probable cause in 16CF31 and binds over.  State calls 16CF83 - Off. Hoege already sworn.  Witness ID's DE.  Record to reflect ID.  Atty Tsai does cross-exam.  Court interrupts Atty Tsai and finds probable cause in 16CF83 and binds over.  State calls Off. Hoege again in 16CF165 - already sworn.  Witness ID's DE.  Record to reflect ID.  Atty Tsai does cross-exam.  Court interrupts Atty Tsai again and finds probable cause and binds over in 16CF165 also.  State notes prelim was already held in 16CF149.  Court notes matter can be set for futher hearings.  Atty Tsai notes they are objecting to any probable cause being found in re: to his client.  Court notes.  State notes DE already received informations today and files originals in Court.  Arraignment to be set.  Bonds continued in all matters.
State's Notice of Motion and Motion to Revoke Bond
Preliminary hearing on August 5, 2016 at 11:00 am.
